name: Natural: Avoid Programs with a high Fan-out
description: Avoid Artifacts with High Fan-Out (Fan-Out > X). The Fan-out of an Artifact is the number of other Artifacts that are referenced in it. When computing the Fan-Out of an Artifact, multiple accesses to the same component of an Artifact are counted as one access. The threshold is a parameter and can be changed at will.
rationale: High coupled artifacts are influencing the Changeability and Robustness of an application. The more inbound and outbound links there are present in the artifact, the more difficult it becomes the change, understand and test.
remediation: Reduce the number of referenced Artifacts
